medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive weight gain of 13.6 kg (30 lbs) since twin pregnancy 4 years ago.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Weight gain began after the twin pregnancy 4 years prior and has been progressive. Ms. T previously had anorexia nervosa and bulimia as a teenager, with a recalled weight of 45 kg (99 lb) in high school. After psychological counseling, she continued to gain weight to 82.7 kg (182 lb) by age 33. Gestational weight gain during her pregnancy reached 114.5 kg (252 lb) at delivery, and she retained 4.5 kg (10 lb) above her prepregnancy weight.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of depression and supraventricular tachycardia treated with cardiac ablation. Only current medication is paroxetine, 50 mg/d.
medical_history.social_history: Ms. T has been married for 7 years and is a nurse practitioner working three 12-hour shifts per week. Her diet includes 3 fast food and ready-to-serve meals daily, with minimal physical activity, primarily due to work and lifestyle demands. She often eats dinner in the car and tends to nibble throughout the day.
